meanings.definition: The quality or state of being pugnacious.
meanings.sent1: His pugnaciousness was evident in the way he always sought out arguments.
meanings.sent2: Her pugnaciousness often led to conflicts with her classmates.
meanings.sent3: The pugnaciousness of the kitten was comical as it tried to pick fights with much larger cats.
meanings.sent4: The pugnaciousness of the storm clouds foretold a fierce thunderstorm.
meanings.sent5: The boxer's pugnaciousness in the ring made him a formidable opponent.

meanings.definition: A disposition to fight or be aggressive.
meanings.sent1: The dog's pugnaciousness was evident when it growled at strangers.
meanings.sent2: His pugnaciousness often got him into trouble at school.
meanings.sent3: Despite his small size, the squirrel showed pugnaciousness when defending its acorns.
meanings.sent4: The pugnaciousness of the waves crashing against the shore was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent5: The politician's pugnaciousness in debates made him a formidable opponent.
